      • getEnumeratedOrEnumerate

        public static java.util.List<org.openrdf.model.Resource> getEnumeratedOrEnumerate(org.openrdf.repository.Repository repository,
                                                                  java.lang.String[] args)
        Parameters:

        args -

      • getEnumeratedOrEnumerate

        public static java.util.List<org.openrdf.model.Resource> getEnumeratedOrEnumerate(org.openrdf.repository.Repository repository,
                                                                  java.lang.String[] args,
                                                                  int startIndex)
        Parse an argument string array and return a Set of Resources representing the contexts. If no contexts are enumerated in the argument array, return all contexts in the repository. For example, "usage: Wc serverURL repositoryID [context ...]" could be handled with getEnumeratedOrEnumerate(Repository repository, String[] args) because the default startIndex is 2. "usage: DumpR serverURL repositoryID directoryPath [context ...]" could be handled with getEnumeratedOrEnumerate(Repository repository, String[] args, 3)
        Parameters:
        repository -
        args -
        startIndex -
        Returns:
        a set of contexts listed in 'args' or all in repository if none are listed.

      • getEnumeratedOrPipe

        public static java.util.Set<org.openrdf.model.Resource> getEnumeratedOrPipe(java.lang.String[] args,
                                                            int startIndex,
                                                            org.openrdf.repository.Repository repository)
        Do same thing as DefaultQuerylet#getContexts, but add PIPE_CONTEXT if empty results.
        Parameters:
        args -
        startIndex -
        repository -
        Returns:

      • getPipeRepository

        public static org.openrdf.repository.Repository getPipeRepository()
        Returns:
        a local-memory Repository containing the RDF from System.in in null context.

      • getPipeRepository

        public static org.openrdf.repository.Repository getPipeRepository(org.openrdf.model.Resource destinationContext)
        Parameters:
        destinationContext - - the context to place the RDF.
        Returns:
        local-memory Repository containing the RDF from System.in.
